result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittney M. Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Full Huber, Stayed-Defendant to call Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm within 72 working hours or by October 25, 2022  for report date within 60 days or no later than December 19, 2022. Failure to do so will result in issuance of a commitment to jail without huber privileges and new criminal charges.

records.addlTxt: 2:31 PM Defendant Brittney M. Ford in court.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman in court for Brittney M. Ford.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count one. Court finds the defendant guilty. PSI waived. Court orders 90 days Jail with full huber and diversion. Defendant to contact diversion by October 25, 2022 and report no later than December 19, 2022. Court costs due December 30, 2022. Counts two and three are dismissed and read in. Felony rights given to defendant. 13 days credit.
